Microbiology.name: Urine Culture and Sensitivity
Microbiology.overview: Detects and identifies bacteria or fungi causing urinary tract infection and determines antibiotic susceptibility.
Microbiology.sample: Midstream clean-catch urine or catheterized specimen
Microbiology.procedure: Inoculation on culture media (e.g., blood agar, MacConkey), incubation, identification, and antibiotic testing

Microbiology.name: Urine Gram Stain
Microbiology.overview: Rapid microscopic test to detect bacteria or yeast in urine before culture results.
Microbiology.procedure: Centrifugation, smear, Gram staining, and microscopy

Microbiology.name: Urine Microscopy (WBC, RBC, Casts)
Microbiology.overview: Microscopic examination of urine sediment for cells, casts, and crystals to assess renal and urinary health.

Microbiology.name: Urine Nitrite Test
Microbiology.overview: Detects nitrite-producing bacteria (e.g., E. coli) in urine dipstick screening.

Microbiology.name: Urine Leukocyte Esterase
Microbiology.overview: Enzyme from WBCs indicating pyuria in UTI.

Microbiology.name: Stool Culture
Microbiology.overview: Identifies pathogenic bacteria causing gastroenteritis (e.g., Salmonella, Shigella, Campylobacter).
Microbiology.procedure: Culture on selective media (e.g., XLD, Campy-BAP), biochemical ID

Microbiology.name: Stool Ova and Parasite (O&P) Examination
Microbiology.overview: Microscopic detection of intestinal parasites and their eggs.

Microbiology.name: Clostridioides difficile Toxin A/B EIA
Microbiology.overview: Detects toxins produced by C. difficile in antibiotic-associated diarrhea.
Microbiology.procedure: Enzyme immunoassay (EIA) for toxins A and B

Microbiology.name: C. difficile GDH Antigen Test
Microbiology.overview: Screening test for glutamate dehydrogenase (GDH), a highly sensitive marker for C. difficile.

Microbiology.name: C. difficile PCR (tcdB gene)
Microbiology.overview: Molecular test detecting toxin gene (tcdB) of C. difficile; highly sensitive and specific.

Microbiology.name: Rotavirus Antigen (Stool)
Microbiology.overview: Detects rotavirus, a common cause of viral gastroenteritis in children.

Microbiology.name: Adenovirus Antigen (Stool)
Microbiology.overview: Detects adenovirus serotypes 40/41 causing pediatric gastroenteritis.

Microbiology.name: Norovirus PCR (Stool)
Microbiology.overview: Molecular detection of norovirus, the leading cause of viral gastroenteritis outbreaks.

Microbiology.name: Fecal Calprotectin
Microbiology.overview: Marker of neutrophil activity in the gut; used to differentiate IBD from IBS.

Microbiology.name: Fecal Occult Blood Test (FOBT)
Microbiology.overview: Detects hidden blood in stool for colorectal cancer screening.
Microbiology.procedure: Guaiac-based chemical reaction or immunochemical test (FIT)

Microbiology.name: Fecal Immunochemical Test (FIT)
Microbiology.overview: Specific detection of human hemoglobin in stool for CRC screening.

Microbiology.name: Stool Fat Qualitative (Sudan Stain)
Microbiology.overview: Detects fat globules in stool indicating malabsorption.
Microbiology.procedure: Microscopic examination after Sudan III staining

Microbiology.name: Quantitative Fecal Fat (72-hour collection)
Microbiology.overview: Gold standard for diagnosing steatorrhea.
high_conditions: >7 g/day: Steatorrhea due to pancreatic, biliary, or mucosal disease

Microbiology.name: Blood Culture (Aerobic and Anaerobic)
Microbiology.overview: Detects bacteremia or fungemia by culturing blood in broth media.
Microbiology.procedure: Automated blood culture system with subculture and ID

Microbiology.name: Blood Culture Gram Stain
Microbiology.overview: Rapid preliminary ID of organisms in positive blood cultures.

Microbiology.name: Sputum Culture
Microbiology.overview: Identifies pathogens causing pneumonia or bronchitis.
Microbiology.procedure: Culture on blood/MacConkey agar, ID, and sensitivity

Microbiology.name: Sputum Gram Stain
Microbiology.overview: Assesses quality of sputum and detects predominant organisms.
Microbiology.procedure: Microscopy for WBCs, epithelial cells, and bacteria
high_conditions: >25 WBCs, <10 epithelial cells/low-power field = good quality

Microbiology.name: Acid-Fast Bacilli (AFB) Smear (Ziehl-Neelsen)
Microbiology.overview: Detects mycobacteria (e.g., M. tuberculosis) in sputum or other samples.

Microbiology.name: AFB Culture (Löwenstein-Jensen or MGIT)
Microbiology.overview: Gold standard for TB diagnosis; slow-growing but highly specific.
Microbiology.procedure: Culture on solid (LJ) or liquid (MGIT) media

Microbiology.name: TB PCR (Xpert MTB/RIF)
Microbiology.overview: Rapid molecular test for M. tuberculosis and rifampin resistance.
high_conditions: TB with or without rifampin resistance

Microbiology.name: Throat Culture
Microbiology.overview: Detects Group A Streptococcus (GAS) in pharyngitis.
Microbiology.procedure: Culture on blood agar with bacitracin disk

Microbiology.name: Rapid Strep Antigen Test
Microbiology.overview: Point-of-care test for GAS antigen.

Microbiology.name: CSF Culture
Microbiology.overview: Detects bacteria, fungi, or viruses in cerebrospinal fluid.
Microbiology.procedure: Culture on blood/chocolate agar, India ink, cryptococcal Ag

Microbiology.name: CSF Gram Stain
Microbiology.overview: Rapid diagnosis of bacterial meningitis.

Microbiology.name: Cryptococcal Antigen (CSF or serum)
Microbiology.overview: Detects capsular polysaccharide of Cryptococcus neoformans.

Microbiology.name: HSV PCR (CSF)
Microbiology.overview: Gold standard for herpes simplex encephalitis.

Microbiology.name: Enterovirus PCR (CSF)
Microbiology.overview: Detects enteroviruses in aseptic meningitis.

Microbiology.name: Wound Culture
Microbiology.overview: Identifies pathogens in skin and soft tissue infections.

Microbiology.name: Anaerobic Culture
Microbiology.overview: Detects obligate anaerobes (e.g., Bacteroides, Clostridium).

Microbiology.name: Fungal Culture
Microbiology.overview: Detects yeasts and molds from clinical specimens.

Microbiology.name: KOH Mount (Skin/Nail)
Microbiology.overview: Rapid detection of fungal hyphae in dermatophytosis.

Microbiology.name: India Ink Preparation (CSF)
Microbiology.overview: Detects encapsulated Cryptococcus in CSF.
Microbiology.procedure: Mix CSF with India ink and examine microscopically

Microbiology.name: Syphilis RPR (Rapid Plasma Reagin)
Microbiology.overview: Non-treponemal screening test for syphilis.

Microbiology.name: Syphilis FTA-ABS
Microbiology.overview: Confirmatory treponemal test for syphilis.

Microbiology.name: HIV Antibody/Antigen (4th gen)
Microbiology.overview: Detects HIV p24 antigen and antibodies for early diagnosis.

Microbiology.name: Hepatitis B Surface Antigen (HBsAg)
Microbiology.overview: Marker of active HBV infection.

Microbiology.name: Hepatitis C Antibody (Anti-HCV)
Microbiology.overview: Screening test for HCV exposure.

Microbiology.name: HCV RNA PCR
Microbiology.overview: Confirms active HCV infection and quantifies viral load.

Microbiology.name: EBV VCA IgM
Microbiology.overview: Indicates acute Epstein-Barr virus infection.
low_conditions: Past EBV infection or no infection

Microbiology.name: CMV IgM
Microbiology.overview: Indicates acute cytomegalovirus infection.

Microbiology.name: Toxoplasma IgG/IgM
Microbiology.overview: Diagnoses acute or past Toxoplasma gondii infection.

Microbiology.name: Rubella IgG
Microbiology.overview: Confirms immunity to rubella (vaccination or past infection).

Microbiology.name: Measles IgM
Microbiology.overview: Diagnoses acute measles infection.

Microbiology.name: Varicella-Zoster Virus (VZV) IgM
Microbiology.overview: Indicates acute chickenpox or shingles.

Microbiology.name: Parvovirus B19 IgM
Microbiology.overview: Diagnoses acute parvovirus infection (e.g., fifth disease).

Microbiology.name: Legionella Urinary Antigen
Microbiology.overview: Detects L. pneumophila serogroup 1 antigen in urine.

Microbiology.name: Pneumococcal Urinary Antigen
Microbiology.overview: Detects S. pneumoniae antigen in urine for pneumonia diagnosis.

Microbiology.name: Helicobacter pylori Urea Breath Test
Microbiology.overview: Non-invasive test for active H. pylori infection.
Microbiology.procedure: Isotope-labeled urea ingestion and breath analysis

Microbiology.name: H. pylori Stool Antigen
Microbiology.overview: Detects H. pylori antigen in stool.

Microbiology.name: H. pylori Serology (IgG)
Microbiology.overview: Indicates past or present H. pylori exposure (not for active infection).

Microbiology.name: Malaria Thick and Thin Smear
Microbiology.overview: Gold standard for malaria diagnosis and species identification.

Microbiology.name: Malaria Rapid Diagnostic Test (RDT)
Microbiology.overview: Detects Plasmodium antigens (e.g., HRP-2, pLDH).

Microbiology.name: Dengue NS1 Antigen
Microbiology.overview: Early marker of dengue virus infection (days 1–5).

Microbiology.name: Dengue IgM/IgG
Microbiology.overview: Serological confirmation of dengue (IgM: acute; IgG: past infection).

Microbiology.name: Chikungunya IgM
Microbiology.overview: Diagnoses acute chikungunya virus infection.

Microbiology.name: Zika Virus RT-PCR
Microbiology.overview: Detects Zika virus RNA in serum or urine during acute infection.

Microbiology.name: Brucella Serology (SAT, ELISA)
Microbiology.overview: Diagnoses brucellosis (undulant fever).

Microbiology.name: Leptospira MAT (Microscopic Agglutination Test)
Microbiology.overview: Gold standard serological test for leptospirosis.

Microbiology.name: Rickettsia IgG/IgM (IFA)
Microbiology.overview: Diagnoses spotted fever or typhus group rickettsiosis.

Microbiology.name: Mycoplasma pneumoniae IgM
Microbiology.overview: Indicates acute Mycoplasma pneumonia.

Microbiology.name: Chlamydia trachomatis NAAT (Urine or Swab)
Microbiology.overview: Nucleic acid amplification test for genital Chlamydia.

Microbiology.name: Neisseria gonorrhoeae NAAT
Microbiology.overview: Molecular detection of gonorrhea.

Microbiology.name: Trichomonas vaginalis Wet Mount
Microbiology.overview: Microscopic detection of motile trichomonads in vaginal discharge.

Microbiology.name: Trichomonas NAAT
Microbiology.overview: Highly sensitive molecular test for Trichomonas.

Microbiology.name: Bacterial Vaginosis (Clue Cells, Whiff Test, pH)
Microbiology.overview: Diagnosis of BV using Amsel criteria.
Microbiology.procedure: Wet mount (clue cells), KOH whiff test, pH >4.5

Microbiology.name: Vaginal Yeast Culture
Microbiology.overview: Identifies Candida species in vulvovaginal candidiasis.

Microbiology.name: HPV DNA Test (High-Risk Types)
Microbiology.overview: Detects oncogenic HPV types (e.g., 16, 18) for cervical cancer screening.

Microbiology.name: Pap Smear (Cervical Cytology)
Microbiology.overview: Screens for cervical dysplasia and cancer.

Microbiology.name: Ascitic Fluid Culture
Microbiology.overview: Diagnoses spontaneous bacterial peritonitis (SBP).
Microbiology.sample: Ascitic fluid (bedside inoculation into blood culture bottles)

Microbiology.name: Synovial Fluid Culture
Microbiology.overview: Detects septic arthritis.

Microbiology.name: Pleural Fluid Culture
Microbiology.overview: Identifies pathogens in empyema or parapneumonic effusion.

Microbiology.name: Pericardial Fluid Culture
Microbiology.overview: Detects infection in pericarditis or tamponade.

Microbiology.name: Antibiotic Susceptibility Testing (AST)
Microbiology.overview: Determines effective antibiotics against isolated pathogens.

Microbiology.name: MRSA Screening (Nasal PCR or Culture)
Microbiology.overview: Detects methicillin-resistant S. aureus colonization.
Microbiology.procedure: PCR for mecA/mecC or culture on MRSA-selective agar

Microbiology.name: VRE Screening (Rectal Swab)
Microbiology.overview: Detects vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus colonization.
Microbiology.procedure: Culture on VRE-selective agar or PCR

Microbiology.name: ESBL Screening
Microbiology.overview: Detects extended-spectrum beta-lactamase-producing Enterobacteriaceae.
Microbiology.procedure: Phenotypic tests (e.g., double-disk synergy) or PCR

Microbiology.name: Carbapenemase Testing (mCIM, PCR)
Microbiology.overview: Detects carbapenem-resistant organisms (e.g., KPC, NDM).
Microbiology.procedure: Modified carbapenem inactivation method (mCIM) or PCR

Microbiology.name: Fungal Beta-D-Glucan
Microbiology.overview: Pan-fungal marker for invasive candidiasis, aspergillosis, Pneumocystis.
low_conditions: No fungal infection (false positives: IVIG, gauze)

Microbiology.name: Aspergillus Galactomannan
Microbiology.overview: Detects Aspergillus antigen in serum or BAL.

Microbiology.name: Pneumocystis jirovecii PCR (BAL)
Microbiology.overview: Detects P. jirovecii DNA in immunocompromised patients with pneumonia.

Microbiology.name: Strongyloides stercoralis Serology
Microbiology.overview: Detects antibodies in strongyloidiasis (stool exams often negative).

Microbiology.name: Schistosoma Serology
Microbiology.overview: Diagnoses schistosomiasis in travelers or immigrants.

Microbiology.name: Toxocara Serology (ELISA)
Microbiology.overview: Diagnoses visceral larva migrans caused by dog/cat roundworm.

Microbiology.name: Echinococcus Serology
Microbiology.overview: Supports diagnosis of hydatid disease.

Microbiology.name: Lyme Disease ELISA + Western Blot
Microbiology.overview: Two-tier testing for Borrelia burgdorferi infection.
Microbiology.procedure: ELISA screening followed by IgM/IgG Western blot if positive/equivocal

Microbiology.name: Anaplasma phagocytophilum PCR
Microbiology.overview: Detects Anaplasma DNA in human granulocytic anaplasmosis.

Microbiology.name: Babesia PCR
Microbiology.overview: Detects Babesia parasites in red blood cells.

Microbiology.name: Bordetella pertussis PCR (Nasopharyngeal Swab)
Microbiology.overview: Detects whooping cough in early stages.

Microbiology.name: Respiratory Viral Panel (Multiplex PCR)
Microbiology.overview: Simultaneous detection of influenza, RSV, adenovirus, etc.

Microbiology.name: Group B Streptococcus (GBS) Screening (Vaginal/Rectal Swab)
Microbiology.overview: Prenatal screening to prevent neonatal GBS sepsis.

Microbiology.name: Group B Strep PCR (Intrapartum)
Microbiology.overview: Rapid intrapartum GBS detection if no prenatal screen.

Microbiology.name: Clostridium tetani Toxin Neutralization
Microbiology.overview: Confirms tetanus toxin production (rarely done clinically).

Microbiology.name: Corynebacterium diphtheriae Tox Gene PCR
Microbiology.overview: Detects tox gene in diphtheria bacilli.

Microbiology.name: Listeria monocytogenes Culture
Microbiology.overview: Detects Listeria in high-risk patients (pregnant, immunocompromised).
